720553f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Barrow Street
720553f-a.text:
(1)
St. Luke's Chapel (Protestant Episcopal, Trinity Parish), 481
Hudson Street, opposite the western end of Grove Street, between
Barrow and Christopher Streets. This is one of the older church
edifices in the city, having been built in 1821.
1914.
Gift of Samuel Landsman:
MAY BE REPiOuL.cDD.
(2)
The church, fifteen years later, seen from the southeast.
June, 1929.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
(3)
The same as (2), seen from the northeast. The building in the
background is the Federal Building and Post Office on Washington Street.
June, 1929.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
720553f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Barrow Street, Manhattan, NY

720551f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Barrow Street
720551f-a.text:
465-477, 481, 487-489 Hudson Street, west side, from Barrow Street
towards Christopher Street. In the center of the block stands St.
Luke's Chapel, one of the older church buildings in New York, erected
in 1821. It is now a part of rinity Parish. No. 487, the first
building north of the church, is the parish house.
October 1, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
720551f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Barrow Street, Manhattan, NY

720547f-a.text:

Hudson Street,west side and north of Barrow Street,showing

(2)
Hudson Street at the south east corner of Christopher Street,
showing P.S.43.

724941f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Barrow Street
724941f-a.text:
Hdson Street (across view from right to left) north from
Barrow Street, showirg a general view of St. Lukes P.E. Chapel
and vicinity as photomraphed in a generallv eastward direction
fror atop the U.S. Appraisers Stores (Custom House). The Church
faces Grove Street hich Pas P.S. No. 3 on the northerlv side of
same. Christophed Street is the next street north. Tis area in
tke midorormnd is better known as Greenwich Village ard consists
rainly of srall huildings.
July 25, 1930.
Views 1 and 2
P.L. Sperr
NO RERRODUCTIONS

720548f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Barrow Street
720548f-a.text:
Hudson Street, east side, north from Barrow Street, showing the
old two-story structures with slanting roof and gables which were
typical of this district in the latter part of the Nineteenth Century
and first few yesrs of the Twentieth. No. 464 on the corner of
Barrow Street, and Nos. 466 to 480, which are frame houses with brick
facing, are about to be replaced by a new brick apartment house.
Beyond Public School No. 3, at the north corner of Grove Street,
notice the new building at 494-496, which has replaced the old houses
shown at that site in 1912 when the Public School was being built.
April, 1925.
Brown Brothers.
NO PEPRODUCTIONS.
720548f-a.folder: Hudson Street & Barrow Street, Manhattan, NY

720550f-a.title: Manhattan: Hudson Street - Barrow Street
720550f-a.text:
Hudson Street, west side, between Barrow and Christopher
Streets, showing St. Luke's Protestant Episcopal Chapel. In the
left background is the U. S. Appraisers Stores building.
1938-9
Alexander Alland
NO REPRODUCTINS
This photo is one of a series that appeared in the p blished volume
''Portrait of N. Y.'' by F lix Reisenberg and Alex. Alland, IRGV.
